Action.Name: Pane.AMSObjectIsInPane
Action.Description: Determines whether or not an specific object is in the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Arg.Name: Object
Arg.Description: The name of the AMS object in question.

Action.Name: Pane.AddAMSObject
Action.Description: Adds an object to the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Arg.Name: AMS Object
Arg.Description: The name of the AMS object to add.

Arg.Name: Position
Arg.Description: A table indexed by X and Y which contains the respective horizontal and vertical position values of the object.

Arg.Name: Size
Arg.Description: A table indexed by Width and Height which contains the respective Width and Height valuse of the object.

Action.Name: Pane.Create
Action.Description: Creates a pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Arg.Name: Properties
Arg.Description: A table containing the pane properties.

Action.Name: Pane.Destroy
Action.Description: Destroys a pane and all child objects.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Arg.Name: Return AMS Objects
Arg.Description: Whether or not any hosted AMS objects should be returned to application window when the pane is destroyed.

Action.Name: Pane.GetDifferential
Action.Description: Gets the x and y differential values.

Action.Name: Pane.GetObjectCount
Action.Description: Gets the number of objects in the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.GetPanes
Action.Description: Gets the names of all panes.

Action.Name: Pane.GetPos
Action.Description: Gets the internal and external position of the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.GetProperties
Action.Description: Gets the properties of the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.GetSize
Action.Description: Gets the internal and external size of the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.GetWndHandle
Action.Description: Gets the window handle of the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.IsAttached
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the specified pane is attached.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.IsEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the specified pane is enabled.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.IsValid
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the specified pane exists and was created and stored properly.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.IsVisible
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the specified pane is visible.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.Maximize
Action.Description: Maximizes the specifed pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.Minimize
Action.Description: Minimizes the specifed pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.OnShow
Action.Description: Used for object persistence across pages.

Action.Name: Pane.OnStartUp
Action.Description: Initializes the Pane plugin.

Action.Name: Pane.RemoveAMSObject
Action.Description: Removes a specific object from the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.Restore
Action.Description: Restores the specifed pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.SetAttached
Action.Description: Attaches or detaches the specified pane from the application window.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.SetDifferential
Action.Description: Sets the x and y differentials. Useful if panes are appearing in the wrong locations do a custom application skin.

Action.Name: Pane.SetEnabled
Action.Description: Enables or disables the specified pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.SetObjectPos
Action.Description: Sets the position of an obeject within a pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.SetObjectSize
Action.Description: Sets the size of an obeject within a pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.SetPos
Action.Description: Sets the internal and external position of the specifed pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.SetProperties
Action.Description: THIS FUNCTION DOES NOT CURRENTLY WORK!

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.SetSize
Action.Description: Sets the internal and external size of the specifed pane.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.Name: Pane.SetVisible
Action.Description: Sets a pane visible or invisible.

Arg.Name: Pane
Arg.Description: The name (not the title) of the pane with which to work.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: If the pane name is invalid, -1 is returned. If the pane already exists then 1 is returned. If the action is successful then the window handle of the new pane is returned.
Action.Example:
local tProps = { Attached = false, DetachToHere = false, DockedType = UNDOCKED, Enabled = true, IgnoreMoveCoT = true, IgnoreSizeCoT = true, Opacity = 200, Sizeable = true, Title = "Hello", TitleBar = true, Visible = true, X=50, Y=50, ExtX=1850, ExtY=50, Width=250, Height=400, ExtWidth=800, ExtHeight=600, };
--[[ This is one of the many window callback functions. This one must be called before the pane is created in order to function. ]]
function test_OnCreate(hWnd) Dialog.Message("Success", hWnd.." has been created"); end
--the pane name is not case sensitive and will be converted to all lowercase. Pane.Create("Test", tProps);
--[[ <Callback Functions> Notice that the above callback function's prefix is all lowercase followed by an underscore then the callback type name. These callback back function names are auto-generated when the pane is created and the names are uniform for all panes.
For example, this pane's callback functions are as follows:
test_OnAttach(hWnd) test_OnClose(hWnd) test_OnDetach(hWnd) test_OnDisable(hWnd) test_OnEnable(hWnd) test_OnHide(hWnd, lParam) test_OnMove(hWnd, nX, nY) test_OnShow(hWnd, lParam) test_OnSize(hWnd, nWidth, nHeight, wParam) test_OnSizing(hWnd, nType) ]]

Extended.Name: Pane
Extended.Description:
The Pane Action Plugin is designed to allow the creation of dynamic windows.

These windows are meant to host windowed obejects that persist across pages and allow access to the app window simultaneously.

With the Pane Action Plugin, there is no realistic limit to the number of panes you can have open at once.
Extended.Author: Centauri Soldier
Extended.InstallNotes: Place the "Pane" folder in the "AutoPlay Media Studio 8.0\Plugins\Actions" folder.
